And I, yeah, and that was, you know, I, and I think also the next day, or Joe Biden came out and said,
you know, these guys ran away from their posts and things and to a degree, I understand
where that came from, but it actually, it upset me because they were really sold out by their
leadership. And I'll give examples. So Safi, the guy that I met that Friday when I was finally
able to get back in contact with him after Mazar had fallen and I asked him, okay, where are you?
And he said, you know, he'd gone out that day and they just, they were so outnumbered and he's
three bodyguards had been killed. And you know, it was really the commandos that were trying to hold
it. And he said, by four o'clock that afternoon, somebody came to him and said, oh, Dustin left.
And so did the commando left? Like, oh, your command is left. And it's up to you if you want to stay
and die or you can leave. And he just, he, they were sold out by everybody.
I did hear stories from guys that I knew that said that the Taliban would like approach a village
and just send a messenger in there and be like, hey, you know, here's your chance. We know you were,
we know you're afghan security. You can put down your guns and be cool or we're going to kill

go back to the way it used to be by the way. That's the other thing it was. They have sort of a lot

the way it used to be. But it's better to do that be alive than be dead. And the amount of sacrifices
that a lot of those afghans soldiers made. I mean, they don't, they weren't even released

is doesn't apply here. There's no clear cut way of, hey, oh, if you get captured, we know what's

Yeah. And he bailed with a bunch of money, by the way. And yeah, a bunch of money is now under
